alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Trempealeau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 12 at 3:31PM CDT until April 12 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 400 PM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN JACKSON AND SOUTHEASTERN TREMPEALEAU COUNTIES... At 330 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near North Bend, or 15 miles southeast of Whitehall, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Quarter size hail. SOURCE...Public. Numerous reports of quarter sized hail have been reported from Winona to Galesville over the past 45 minutes. IMPACT...Damage to vehicles is expected. This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Jackson and southeastern Trempealeau Counties, including the following locations... Franklin, Highway 95 And County D, North Creek, Peacock Hill, Camp Decorah, Beach Corners and Frenchville. HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
